instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2013-2014 LCD Replacement Parts. Any good reputable suppliers?
threads.message:
Does Rossmann Group have access to just the LCD panel for this model? If not, any recommended supplier for just the LCD panel?

Thanks!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2013-2014 LCD Replacement Parts. Any good reputable suppliers?
threads.message: I have not been able to buy that since 2015. I stocked up on 300 of them and used them all up a long time ago. Now you are pretty much stuck looking for used assemblies. Always remember to make sure your customer knows why you are limited in your options to help them, how the manufacturer uses non-standard parts and tries their best to make them unavailable to you.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2013-2014 LCD Replacement Parts. Any good reputable suppliers?
